website_summaries.verdict: Outdoorsy individuals who value comfort and waterproofness may love the benefits this piece of gear offers. In addition, its durable build and surface traction leaves a good mark on those who have used this boot.However, its toe box configuration leaves a lot to be desired because of its restrictive design. All in all, the Berghaus Explorer Trek GTX may render a satisfactory experience, as long as users understand the drawbacks that come with it.
pros: A lot of Berghaus Explorer Trek GTX reviews from countless users state that it is a satisfyingly comfy boot for hiking trips
Its durability amazes a majority of shoppers
A handful of adventurers love the arch support of this Berghaus offering
Numerous shoppers confirm that the Explorer Trek GTX is a delightfully waterproof hiking boot
More than a couple of verified purchasers commend its outsole for being grippy on varied terrain
A minority of outdoor lovers appreciate the lightness of this footgear
cons: Several buyers say that the Berghaus Explorer Trek GTX’s toe box is too narrow
According to some wearers, its break-in period is too long
This piece of gear is not breathable, a few consumers report

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: This boot described as waterproof allows moisture to seep through the outer layer of the boot. Usage has not been heavy but the left boot boot leaks like a sieve . The boot has not been used during periods of rain or any bad weather. The fault has shown itself whilst walking through low level grass moistened by early morning dew. The fit is good and the boots are comfortable but a waterproof boot should actually keep out water. Unlike my old Berghaus boots long round laces the new pattern has a much shorter 'civilian' flat lace which does not allow for double knotting. Consequently, occasionally the lace can come undone.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Ian

customer_reviews.title: Splendid boots at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and worn for first time on a trek in the Brecon Beacons. I can report back that they were instantly comfortable and most definitely waterproof. They provided good support and excellent grip. The additional advantage of buying these at a very good price, means they were a successful birthday present.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've had two or three pairs of these boots and between them they've been up hundreds of hills and mountains. I find them comfortable, they grip well and they keep the water out, though after several years the Goretex wears out and they leak. This is the first time I've bought unseen. The new boots are almost identical to the old ones but they seem a trifle longer. They'll do though.
customer_reviews.author: DBB

customer_reviews.title: An excellent pair of boots.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable and great in wet conditions. I do quite a bit of mileage between 30 & 50 miles a week & my last pair wore down the heals in about 18 months but they had done a total of over 1,600 miles.
customer_reviews.author: MR_Wales

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper with another seller
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing berghaus boots for about 20 years... The quality has gone down and down and this was no exception... But I returned them because I found them almost £15 cheaper from another seller...
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Second pair as good as the first
customer_reviews.text: Second pair (first pair lasted me over 8 years and had done some serious mileage) so no grainer to get another. Very comfortable, great fit and after a 6 mile first outing no problems whatsoever. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for serious hiking
customer_reviews.text: These are a replacement for similar that we bought over 10 years ago, which took serious punishment and I hate to part with. However these are even better made and do comfortable
customer_reviews.author: R Cleaver

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, sole does seem to be an improvement
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, and comfortable. New sole does seem to be an improvement (previous explorer boots) on most surfaces but i did slip on wet limestone but looking around at others they too were having difficulties in their foot wear so one needs to be realistic Have not used the boots in snow yet.
customer_reviews.author: jani

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, light, rugged - great shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable straight out of the box; light, waterproof, great product. Anti clog sole works well. Super grip.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael J. Wisbey

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Great product - again. Third pair I've bought in the last 20 years, need to buy men's as women's only do up to a UK8 & I wear UK9. I could walk for ever in these boots, so comfortable from day one and give excellent ankle support. Expensive - but certainly well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jacksb

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable waterproof good all round walking boot
customer_reviews.text: At last! A decent, comfortable, lightweight and WATERPROOF boot, guaranteed. Really pleased. Laces that tie without slipping and sliding. Easy to get on and off. Easy to clean. A good all round general walking boot at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Whether it is a wide fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the boots as they seemed similar to old ones which were nice and wide. Sadly these were not as wide and I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: David Storer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery. Great boots. Similar to the last pair that lasted years. V pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Buttonpusher

customer_reviews.title: Out of box comfort that improves with age.
customer_reviews.text: The only make and model of walking boot I use now ... I’ve had 3 versions of this boot ... with each succession bringing new refinements.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Worn for first time taking dog for 1 hr walk through wet grass and got home with wet feet, now returned for full refund. Replaced older Berghaus boots now worn out but waterproof so disappointed. Used Amazon as Gaynors sold out of my size, have learnt my lesson, will be phoning Gaynors.
customer_reviews.author: Bennyboy

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expeditor Trek!
customer_reviews.text: bit the bullet and bought the more expensive boots, of which i have had two pairs before! bought to replace Berghaus expeditor trek boots which split just over a year after buying them! but they do do a lot of walking, usually between 20 and 30 miles a week walking the dogs in all weathers. worth spending the extra £40-£50. wouldn’t recommend buying the expeditor trek although they cost about £90 not very good!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil N

product_meta.title: Berghaus Men's Explorer Trek Gore-tex Waterproof Walking Boots
product_meta.description: Pop them on, head out and be confident you’re covered with these ideal, breathable suede boots. Lightweight, they’re also hugely supportive right where you need it. Comfort is the name of the game with the classic Explorer fit being a well-trodden favourite. This, combined with the OrthoLite Hike cushioned footbed keeps feet feeling comfy all day long. A durable sole, with excellent grip and enhanced flexibility is always a crowd pleaser. Plus, the new anti-mud-clogging system powered by the trusty grip of OPTI-STUD maximises your gripping ability, ensuring you’re stable even in tricky conditions. As for being waterproof, well GORE-TEX has dry feet taken care of .
feature_bullets: Light and reliable, this robust waterproof hiking boot makes everyday trekking a breeze
Waterproof guarantee - no more soggy socks with the fully waterproof and breathable Gore-Tex performance lining
Sheer comfort - keep feet feeling revived and comfortable with superb cushioning from the OrthoLite hike footbeds
Feel sure-footed with grip from the VIBRAM rubber sole
Maximise grip on every step with the new anti-mud-clogging system
